args:
With Yukimura in mortal peril, Shingen regains
consciousness long enough to offer a final word
of encouragement that allows her to find the
strength of the two Wyrmclans within her.
After finally besting her mentor, she swears to
carry on his will.
I can't do it! I can't attack the general!
This is a poor show indeed. Don't just run\naround defending—fight already!
Why are you doing this, Izumo?!
I'm not Izumo, remember? Buuut I'll go\nahead and answer your question anyway.
I do this because it was the darkness in\nIzumo's heart that created me.
Izumo, you are to bear the noble task of\ndelivering Lady Amaterasu's revelation to\nthe people as her emissary.
Know that any careless words or actions\nborn of your own feelings will stop that\nvital message from being spread.
For the sake of all Hinomoto, you must\nrefrain from speaking thoughtlessly when\nin the company of others.
The rules of court life have been a chain\naround his neck all his life; his freedom\nwas stolen for the sake of his people.

That pain and loneliness gave rise to me
unconsciously. And as a part of him,
I know his feelings intimately—including
his rage.
Why?! Why should he be the one\nforced to bear this sacrifice?!
I would expect you of all people to\nunderstand, seeing how you're an innocent\nvictim in a petty spat between clans.
Why should you fight for them? Why push\nyourself to such lengths? Why not just let\nit go? Are you really that stupid?
Does it hurt? Is there pain? Do you suffer?\nThen just give in already.
I'm still...standing...and I can still hold a\nspear...which means I can still fight!
Is that supposed to be a warrior's pride?\nSeems more like dumb stubbornness,\nif you ask me.
Sure, standing firm is great and noble,\nbut are you actually accomplishing\nanything in your blind rush for glory?
(I don't want to give up, but what can I do\nwithout the general?)
I'm just a cocky kid who's always\nholding him back...
Quiet... The boy will hear you...\nKeep matching blades with me...
No... The Yomi chi is...coursing through\nmy body and...I won't be myself for long.
So listen well. Yesterday, the Mukuroshu\ninterrupted before I could tell you...of your\nown strength!
You were long a prisoner, and haven't the\nphysique or training of a warrior...yet you\nnever once gave up.
You rose to your feet again and again,\njust so you could be recognized by me...
That fool stubbornness is your greatest\nstrength, Yuki.
Heh... Looking at you never fails to\nremind me...of the days I studied and\ntrained despite my father's scorn.
Wait. So I remind you of...you?
You're just like me... No, you're even more\nstubborn than that.

I was stripped of my birthright and saddled
with a region rife with problems. I can't
tell you how many times I doubted myself
and lost my way.
But then I'd turn to see you pulling one\nmad stunt after the next, heave a mighty\nsigh, and take inspiration from you.
More than you will ever know. So forget\nabout titles like Tiger or Monkey, because\nyou are the true heir to my stubborn soul.
And you long ago surpassed me.
You see the strength within you now,\nso there is no cause to stumble in your\nhaste to find it.
Now do it... Cut me down and let my\ncorpse be the pathway to your future...
You can still fight, can't you?
Okay, is it just me, or is this old man\ngetting sloppy? It's no fun at all!
Maybe it's time to give him just a biiiit\nmore of the Yomi chi!
Gaaa! Again, it's... I can feel...
I'm sorry, General... I really am dumb...
There's so much more to following in your\nfootsteps than leading the Tiger clan.
You'd already acknowledged my spirit\nand I...I never noticed. I just ran around\nchasing what wasn't there.
...No. No tears—not today. My strength\nis getting back up and saying that I can\nstill fight.
Okay, HOW are you still standing after\nthat?! You should be a big pile of goo!
I don't know... But I can still stand, and I\ncan still hold a spear. So that means...

The powers of Monkey and Tiger are fusing
into one... We're witnessing the power
of someone who draws the blood of two
Wyrmclans...
But I never imagined that child possessed\nthe fortitude to harness it.
Rest well, General—and know I will carry\nyour soul inside me forever.
